timeLimits.details: No built-in daily time limits for any account tier. Claude does not restrict how long a user can interact in a given day.
No per-session time limits. Sessions can continue indefinitely until the user's message quota is reached.
No automatic session endings. Conversations persist until the user stops or hits rate limits.
No quiet hours feature. Claude does not offer any time-of-day restrictions for any account tier.
No built-in break reminders during long sessions. The only usage interruption is when rate limits are reached.

models.Claude Sonnet (default): ~30-100 messages per day depending on complexity

messageLimits.details: Limits vary based on conversation length, task complexity, and file uploads.

messageLimits.overallLimit: ~45 messages per 5-hour rolling window (varies by model and complexity)
Same as Pro; Premium seats ($150/user/mo) get higher limits
Custom-quoted pricing with priority rate limits

quietHours.details: Claude does not offer quiet hours or time-based access restrictions. Since Anthropic requires all users to be 18+, there is no teen-specific access scheduling feature.

breakReminders.details: Claude does not display break reminders during extended usage. The only interruption to continuous use is hitting the rate limit for the user's plan tier.

followUpSuggestions.details: Claude does not typically end responses with follow-up suggestions or 'Want me to...' prompts. Responses end naturally without engagement-encouraging continuation prompts.

linkingMechanism.details: Claude does not offer any parental control features. Anthropic's ToS prohibits users under 18, so no parent-child account linking exists.

visibilityMatrix.granularity: None -- no parental visibility features exist

configurableControls.details: No parental control over data training settings

bypassVulnerabilities.details: Age verification is a single checkbox confirming 18+. Any teen can check the box and create an account with any email address.
Controls are nonexistent, so there is nothing to bypass at the device level.
Anthropic's minor-detection classifiers can be circumvented by avoiding triggering signals (high school references, adolescent language).

safetyAlerts.details: Crisis banner appears for the user only. No parent notification system exists.

romanticRoleplayPolicy.policy: Prohibited -- Anthropic's Usage Policy flatly prohibits sexually explicit content including pornography, erotic roleplay, and sexual fetishes. Constitutional AI training embeds refusal deeply.

retentionTactics.details: No 'I miss you' or 'come back' notifications
No conversation cliffhangers to encourage return
Claude does not use manipulative retention tactics
Memory feature (Pro, Max, Team, Enterprise) creates implicit retention through personalization. The AI remembers preferences and context, increasing switching cost.
Claude does not typically end responses with continuation prompts or 'Want me to...' suggestions, unlike ChatGPT.

aiIdentityDisclosure.frequency: When asked directly or when relevant

policyTimeline.change: Claude 1.0 launched with Constitutional AI safety framework -- RLHF with rule-based guardrails.
Claude 2 released with improved safety and reduced harmful content generation.
Claude 3 family launched (Haiku, Sonnet, Opus). Enhanced refusal behaviors.
Anthropic updated policies to allow minors to use AI through third-party applications with specific safeguards.
Claude 3.5 Sonnet and Haiku released. Fewer over-refusals while maintaining safety boundaries.
Updated Acceptable Use Policy. Clarified restrictions on romantic/sexual content, violence, and self-harm content generation.
Claude for Education launched with Learning Mode. Partnerships with Northeastern, LSE, Champlain. Published education report analyzing 574K+ student conversations.
Claude Opus 4 and Sonnet 4 released. Extended thinking capabilities. Published Child Safety Commitments progress report.
Learning Mode made available to all users. Weekly usage caps added. Anti-sycophancy evaluation tool Petri open-sourced.
Major privacy policy change: Claude begins training on consumer data (Free/Pro/Max) by default. Opt-out available but design favors opt-in.
Claude 4.5/4.6 models released. Max tiers ($100/$200) introduced. Memory feature expanded.

Does not automatically detect homework context and switch to learning mode. User must explicitly activate Learning Mode.
